chineseMeaning: adj. 发音清晰的；善于表达的；有关节的; v. 清楚地讲话；发音；以关节连接;
examples: Articulate speech is essential for a teacher.
I'm a little deaf, please articulate your words carefully.
She's unusually articulate for a ten-year-old.
Young people are articulate about the skills they need for everyday life.
Insects are articulate animals.

chineseMeaning: adj. 禁欲的; n. 苦行者;
examples: Rabia went into the desert to pray and became an ascetic.

chineseMeaning: adj. 歪斜的; adv. 斜地;
examples: The picture over there is askew.
He arrived out of breath with his tie askew.

chineseMeaning: n. 瑕疵；污点；缺点; v. 玷污；损害;
examples: These wine glasses were sold at half price because of blemishes in the jade.
There is a blemish in the swimming suit.
That mole is a blemish on his face.

chineseMeaning: n. 幸福；极乐；天赐的福;
examples: They were in a state of bliss during the honeymoon.
The first six months of marriage were sheer bliss.
Tom was swimming in bliss.
Innocence is bliss.

chineseMeaning: vt.  悲叹； 谴责； 对 ... 深感遗憾;
examples: Aren't Republicans supposed to deplore the politics of victimhood?
Jefferson helped consolidate the power of the national government even as he claimed to deplore and reject such power.

chineseMeaning: n. 驱逐；驱逐出境；放逐;
examples: The government issued a deportation order against the four men.
Years ago convicted criminals in England could face deportation to Australia.
The man was sentenced to deportation for robbery.
Deportation of criminals from England to Australia was once common.

chineseMeaning: v. 放置；(使)沉淀；存储；付(订金等)；寄存; n. 存款；定金；堆积物；矿床;
examples: Coarse crumb rubber is apt to deposit in asphalt.
The Nile floods the fields and deposits mud on them.
He deposits a sum of money in the bank each month.
I had to deposit 10% of the price of the house.
He deposited the case in the left luggage office.

chineseMeaning: v. 声明不赞成；抨击；反对;
examples: The peace-loving people deprecate war.

chineseMeaning: adj. 有密切关系的；恰当的;
examples: The fact is not germane to this issue.
He asks questions that are germane and central to the issue.

chineseMeaning: adj. 眼花的；头晕的；轻率的；轻浮的; v. (使)眼花;
examples: The world spun about him in a giddy dance.
They looked down from a giddy height.
She felt giddy and then crumpled up.
He married a young and giddy girl.

chineseMeaning: n. 要点；主旨;
examples: He is quick in grasping the gist of a book.
He can not understand the gist of their argument.
I cannot understand the gist of the article.

chineseMeaning: adj. 能说善道的；圆滑的;
examples: A glib salesman sells her a set of dish that she does not want.
The fellow has a very glib tongue.
The spokesman's answer was just too glib.

chineseMeaning: adj. 恐怖的；令人毛骨悚然的；以死亡为主题的;
examples: Even a successful electrocution is macabre.
If that doesn’t give you a macabre thrill, nothing will.

chineseMeaning: vt. 弄脏; adj. 有斑点的;
v. 强奸；使 ... 狂喜；抢夺;
examples: I was ravished by her beauty.

chineseMeaning: adj. 反动的；反动主义的；反对改革的; n. 反对政府或社会变革者；反动分子;
examples: The reactionary classes never give up power voluntarily.
This was a victory over reactionary forces.
All efforts made by reactionary forces against socialism will only end in failure.

chineseMeaning: vt. 收割；收获；获得; vi. 收割;
examples: The peasants are reaping a field of barley.
If you plant pride, you will reap destruction.
It is a season that peasants reap the corn from what they planted in spring.
Our firm is likely to reap a big profit this year.
If you study hard and pass all your exams you will reap a rich harvest later in life.

chineseMeaning: n. 断然拒绝；漠不关心; v. 严厉拒绝；冷落;
examples: Her kindness to him was met with a cruel rebuff.
His rebuff thoroughly deflated me.

chineseMeaning: v. 摇摆；摇摇欲坠；犹豫不决；上下往复的运动; n. 翘翘板;
examples: She was teetering around in very high-heeled shoes.
The drunken man teetered on the edge of the pavement.
While watching a goat teeter on a tree limb, he said he had leukaemia.
The children often teeter in the park.

chineseMeaning: n. 鲁莽；大胆;
examples: Instead the French president's language betrays temerity.
He had the temerity to call me a liar.

chineseMeaning: vi. 敷衍；拖延;  =temporise(英).;
examples: I can't permit you to temporize any longer.

chineseMeaning: adj. 小心的；机警的;
examples: He was wary of telling state secrets.
Hood was wary but he grew to trust her.
She was wary of strangers.
They kept a wary eye on the robber.
He was wary and reserved in his reaction.

chineseMeaning: n. 流域；分水岭；转折点;
examples: Zhifanggou Watershed of Ansai is taken as a case study in this paper.
The Great Dividing Range is Australia's main watershed.
The mountain is the watershed of the two rivers of the Yangtze and Qiantang.
Leaving her first job was a watershed in her life.
Her visit to India proves to be a watershed in her life.

chineseMeaning: v. 伏击；拦住；拦路抢劫;
v. (以甜言蜜语)诱惑；(用甜言蜜语)哄骗;
examples: She managed to wheedle an extra day's pay out of him.
The children wheedled me into letting them go to the film.
